title: Snoop Dogg defends university gig in Kansas after backlash
text:
Snoop Dogg has been defending his university gig in Kansas after backlash (Picture: Rex Features)

Snoop Dogg won’t be apologising for any performance he gives, no matter how raunchy.

The rapper, 47, was recently booked to perform at a University of Kansas basketball rally and while it’s safe to say his gig went off, it caused a little bit of a stir.

According to TMZ, things got a little X-rated and there were pole dancers, money guns, the lot.

The not-so family friendly display saw the uni later issue an apology, insisting they hadn’t wanted to cause ‘offence’.

KU’s Director of Athletics said in a statement: ‘We made it clear to the entertainers’ managers that we expected a clean version of the show and took additional steps to communicate to our fans, including moving the artist to the final act of the evening, to ensure that no basketball activities would be missed if anyone did not want to stay for his show.

‘I take full responsibility for not thoroughly vetting all the details of the performance and offer my personal apology to those who were offended.

It’s actually happening. Snoop Dogg is actually at Allen Fieldhouse #kubball pic.twitter.com/V76w7PyOLa — 580 Sports Talk (@580Sportstalk) October 5, 2019

‘We strive to create a family atmosphere at Kansas and fell short of that this evening.’

Snoop’s response? If you’re gonna book Snoop Dogg, you’re gonna get Snoop Dogg.

Speaking on Howard Stern, he said: ‘The audience enjoyed that sh*t. I don’t know what the f**k they’re talking about.’

He denied claims he was asked to leave after his gig, telling Stern: ‘That’s a motherf**king lie. I had the time of my life, I enjoyed myself, hung out with the basketball teams.’

‘I think it was more the publicity of what I did. they had to cover it up,’ Snoop said. ‘I respect them, and I wasn’t gonna put no smut on their name and say they did anything wrong because they invited me to come do what I do.’

He pointed out: ‘When you pay for Snoop Dogg, you gon’ get Snoop Dogg.’

Corde, Snoop’s eldest son, recently lost his third child Kai Love (Picture: Zuma Press/PA Images)

Snoops’ performance in Kansas comes after his family’s recent heartache. The artist’s eldest son Corde sadly lost his third child, Kai Love, last month.

The newborn had died in Corde’s arms just 10 days after he was born.

Corde revealed the heartbreaking news on Instagram and paid tribute to his baby boy by penning: ‘My son did all he needed to do in his 10 days here on earth.

‘He has now graduated and continuing to do work. He died in my arms and that feeling of energy will never leave me.’

Corde is also dad to daughter Elleven and son Zion. Snoop, meanwhile, is father to Corde, daughter Cori and sons Cordell and Julian.
